top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
How did locks which enable you to lock yourself out of your own home ever take off? That's absurd, right?
Better LPT: have all exterior doors only lock via key or combination with a deadbolt. That way you can only be locked out by someone with a key or someone that's still inside.

Keep a secure key accessible from outside your house. Invest in a locking real estate key box and put it somewhere inconspicuous. Great not just for you locking yourself out, but for emergencies when family or friends need into your house while you are away.
I lock the door from inside and keep the key in the lock, that way i have to use the key to get out and have it in my hand.
